p: Psoralen ( Fig. 1C) interacted with HBV Pol by forming one hydrogen bond with Lys32 and two hydrogen bonds with Arg41. It also formed one Pi-cation electrostatic interaction with His160. Notably, His160 was also involved in forming one Pi-Pi T-shaped hydrophobic interaction with Psoralen. Moreover, the complex of psoralen and HBV Pol was stabilized by one Pi-alkyl hydrophobic interactions with Pro5 and Met171 while Ala86 formed three Pi-alkyl hydrophobic interactions ( Fig. 7C). Other residues that surrounded psoralen were Ser40, Tyr89, Phe88 and Ala87. The Gibb's free energy of psoralen-Pol interaction was predicted to be −6.4 kcal/mol which corresponded to a binding constant of 4.9 × 10 4/mol ( Table 2).
